title: How to Eliminate Salt Build Up on Clay Pots

steps.headline: Brush off as much loose salt as possible from the pot.
Dampen a clean white rag with some vinegar.
steps.description: Wipe across the salty areas to remove the build-up.

steps.headline: Allow area to dry for a few hours, and reapply the vinegar if there are still salt marks.
After you've removed the salt marks, wipe down the clay pot several times with a wet rag dampened in water.
steps.description: Unglazed clay is an absorbent material and will "soak up" the vinegar, and may eventually find its way to the roots as you water the plant in the future.

text: Brush off as much loose salt as possible from the pot.  Dampen a clean white rag with some vinegar. Wipe across the salty areas to remove the build-up. Allow area to dry for a few hours, and reapply the vinegar if there are still salt marks.  After you've removed the salt marks, wipe down the clay pot several times with a wet rag dampened in water. Unglazed clay is an absorbent material and will "soak up" the vinegar, and may eventually find its way to the roots as you water the plant in the future.
